word:
"We have moved out by faith and have made large advancement," Mrs. White wrote at the close of 1899, 
                                                                           375
"because we saw what needed to be done, and we dared not hesitate. But we have not done the half of that which should be done. We are not yet on vantage ground. There is a great work before us. All about us are souls longing for light and truth; and how are they to be reached? . . .
